website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty conditioner with waxy consistency increases lifetime of worn-out leather bags, boots, and more.
pros: Removes old scuff marks, and a little goes a long way
May increase lifetime of leather item
Protects leather from soil and mold growth
cons: Application time is lengthy process and requires a lot of elbow grease

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff completely revived my Durango shoes. My only regret is not putting it on them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Barton

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: The initial outcome of product is very deceiving. I applied the conditioner to a new pair of boots to protect them from harsh weather conditions in NYC. The shine was so amazing I applied to a second pair of boots that had lost all luster. The second pair looked amazing as well. However, the following day both pairs of boots were extremely dull! Had to use several applications of other conditioners as well as shoe polish to take away the dull affect. STAY AWAY!!! I would have rated this product less than 0, but that was not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Rell

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use on a pair of Timberland Pros. I got the most unbelievable results and couldn't be happier with the outcome. Application was a bit labor intensive, as two coats took about an hour and a half. It did darken the leather a lot compared to the traditional, iconic yellow tint that timberland has, but I wanted a darker leather anyway so it was a win win. My boots held up great in New York's record breaking blizzard on 1/22. The snow piled up, beaded up and rolled right off and my feet were bone dry. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to increase the longevity of their boots 10 fold.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Obenauf's Havy Duty LP is some great stuff. I live in the Snowy Mountain Range ...
customer_reviews.text: Obenauf's Havy Duty LP is some great stuff. I live in the Snowy Mountain Range of Wyoming. That means harsh cold winters, which is hard on boots. Between hiking in the mountains for hunting, to long nights working at the ski resort making snow, this stuff keeps my boots going. It will darken the leather, but will dang well keep em healthy. I like to put on a layer (using my hands to melt, and massage in the Obenauf's) and then set my boots by the fire place to heat up the leather and allow it to soak in. Then apply a second coat and repeat.
customer_reviews.author: ASM

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious with shoes/boots with stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended for shoes/boot with decorative stitching. The excess LP is white and remains this color when embedded in stitching.
customer_reviews.author: RNR

customer_reviews.title: Waterproofing? No.
customer_reviews.text: This goes on beautifully. The leather feels great afterwards. Long term we'll see how the leather hold up. Does darken considerably. As to the waterproofing abilities? No. Not at all. Even with 3 coats, a hairdryer and 'waterproof' boots. Waterproofing is what I bought this for. Does smell lovely though. The Irish Setters went back. 3 coats of this, applied with hairdrier over 3 days. Feet absolutely soaked. From lawn grass. Walking to get paper. So no use as waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst stuff I have ever used. It was like applying glue to a beautiful leather tote bag.
customer_reviews.author: lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using leather conditioners like this for over 60 years and found them to be up to the task of preserving my leather boots. Although I have never used this particular brand, it seems very close to the conditioners I have used in the past and am quite sure it will perform quite well. Since I have used products like this before, I started by placing the boots and conditioner in the sun until both were quite warmed. This made the application, using a tooth brush and my fingers, very easy. Then I let them dry in the sun and the results were wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Green Rider

customer_reviews.title: Best boot goo ever made
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff, yeah its expensive but i just bought my second tub in probably 15 years, lasts a long time, you dont need much. I have Red Wing work boots that have seen heavy use in and outdoors since 2010 and they still are in great shape, my previous pair i bought in '04 and retired them (still in ok condition) more than 10 years later. Much better than synthetic silicone based products that go on top of the leather, this soaks in and keeps leather supple and strong. I use it for my work gloves too, but it takes a few days to quit being greasy.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Motzing

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best, and it smells good, too.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second tub I've ordered after going through one. I love how this protects my Redwings and my hiking boots. They keep out salt and wet in the winter, and when they do get a little weathered, scuffed, or salt damaged, the waxy balm that is Obenauf's puts it right again. My 12 year old boots look better than my buddy's 3 year old boots because of better care, not avoiding things that might scuff or damage the leather!
customer_reviews.author: North Star State Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend - humane and effective!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to polish all my Frye boots and am impressed. I was going to buy mink oil, but cannot justify it from a humane perspective. The poor minks!! Fortunately, there are alternatives, such as this wonderful product. Conditioned beautifully, and while there was very slight darkening to my brown boots, I didn't mind at all. I did 4 pairs of leather boots and probably only used 1/6 of the tub. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Best product I have found for leather care.
customer_reviews.text: What can I can... THANK YOU! Was a Hurricane Harvey flood victim. I have been using this on two pairs work boots and my leather jacket I work in. When we evacuated out facing a flash flood situation I left everything. I lost several pairs of boots but the boots that had this product on them look like new and had no mold or mildew. I wear a size 14-15 boot. Not easy to find something Like. Thank you for great product. The leather coat is a 2xlt I have had for 20 years. Everything was under water for 7 days. 6 feet of water for 7days. This stuff is great. Do not hesitate to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: DEKE

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help waterproof a new pair of shoes and ended up giddily rubbing it into every piece of leather I own, from the coasters to my headboard. It smells great (pure beeswax; light honey scent), it makes leather look beautiful and you rub it in with your hands, which ends up feeling like you just got some kind of high-end paraffin wax treatment. And of course, it works as promised. Very pleased to have discovered this.
customer_reviews.author: GothamGirl

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down, The Best Product for Shoes/Boots
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best shoe polish I have ever used. Prior to wearing boots most of my time now, I was a white collar worker wearing oxfords all the time, I’ve always been shining and polishing my shoes. I used these on my boots and I’m telling you, it will take your dull, dried out boots and make them new again. It does darker the tint a bit, but most polish does. It long lasting as well. I was skeptical to polish with my hands like the directions said, but it does work better as it melts nicely from the warmth of your fingers. I will only be using this product going forward.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: Great in moderation
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. I recommend it for your boots, but not immediately out of the box. Quality leather boots are treated with oils and wax before leaving the manufacturer, so applying obenaufs right away can be overkill. It WILL change the color of your leather, forever! It will darken your boots considerably. I recommend waiting until you’ve worn your boots a month or two. This stuff smells great, waterproofs leather fantastically.
customer_reviews.author: jed lamagdelaine

customer_reviews.title: Keeps leather boots going longer
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked for us for many years. It helps with water resistance for boots that endure many hard miles of woodlands, coarse brush, and wet grass. Not saying that it water proofs, but it really does help with leather preservation despite upland conditions. We apply it to new boots, and continue to use as often as necessary to replenish the leather.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great product for Brooks saddles, boots or anything leather!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on both my work boots as well as my Brooks bike saddle. It really is great stuff. I can already tell that the tiniest little jar is going to last me YEARS. You barely use any at all when you apply it. It doesn’t seem to retain its weather resistant properties as long on my saddle as my boots but I suspect it’s just because the waxy coating gets rubbed off more quickly from wear. It still conditions very well and it’s safe to apply with your bare hands (in fact, it’s recommended)! Leave my hands feeling nice as a bonus when I’m finished with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ted W.

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I work in and around ponds and this waterproofing has turned my Carolina boots into my go to boots. dont get me wrong I still use my muck boots, but if I know I'm going ankle or less into water I dont even change my boots. I have waterproofed my Carolinas and both my wife and I's cowboy boots all with 2 coats so that's 6 total application out of this little container and there is still enough left to apply one more coat onto a pair of boots. I will be ordering more and i highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great product, brought old shoes back to life.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend never throws a pair of shoes away, so he has acquired quite the collection of old, worn shoes. I always tell him to toss an old pair when he gets a new one, but he insists they all stay. I bought him this as a gift and after one application they have brought his shoes back to life. I do not know about their waterproof and weatherproof claims, as he hasn't worn the treated shoes yet, but this is worth the buy just for its ability to breathe life back into your favorite worn out shoes. We are ordering more as a gift for his step-dad, now.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Best Leather Protectant
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stuff I've used on hunting boots, work boots, and casual leather shoes/boots. I put my boots and the container near the fire (or on a radiator) to make application easier. I recommend using a small rag (about 4x4 in.) and storing it inside the container for future use. The LP applies easily when it's warm. Leave your boots somewhere very warm overnight and the LP will penetrate the leather and yield excellent water resistance. One note - this will darken the leather after you've applied it, so be aware if you are using it on light/medium toned casual footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: I read a review of this,, I now agree....it truly is the best...it will darken your shoes is all
customer_reviews.text: Utterly the best shoe care cream I've ever used. Truly. I use a horsehair 1 1/2 wide paint brush to brush it on. Then let sit, then buff it off with a normal horsehair shoe brush. It is truly the best shoe care, and I wouldn't use anything else, it's a one substance all purpose shoe care/shining solution.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckBeattyxHOEYologist75to03

customer_reviews.title: Leather's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: I first started using this product for my leather hiking boots that soon gave way to my leather bicycle saddle (seat). The warmer the object, the faster the oil penetrates, I usually allow for 15 minutes in the sun before applying or use a hair dryer that is not too close to the object and then watch it soak in . I might wait a few hours or the next day to wipe any leftover off. Does it work? Yes! Helps break in leather and then protects it, to include the stitching around the welt where any sewing is done. Great American product that works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin RobTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent when used on hard used leathers
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use on my older western saddles and hard worn boots. Wow! Great stuff with a bit of advice, a little goes a long way and do thin layers(yes that is with an "s"). Once buffed out , there's a beautiful warm glow and love the smell of beewax. This maybe a problem if saddles were kept where rodents could get at treated leather. using thin layers minimizes build up. Definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: crogers

customer_reviews.title: Makes your boots very dark
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews saying that their boots were dark when done. I should have listened to them. I got this on the mail today and tried it on my Wolverine work boots. I used this product sparingly. It instantly turned my medium brown boot to a dark brown. I tried using a horse hair brush and then a paper towel, but it didn’t change anything. Since I had one dark boot, I had to do the other so they would match. I don’t know if this will wear off with time. We’ll see. If you have black boots, I guess you’re ok.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Reid

customer_reviews.title: Golden Honey
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Used this on the vachetta on several of my handbags today. It gave them a slight honey patina and I am so happy. I shared with my purse lovers community. Many orders to come! Kudos to this lovely product! Tag in photo is without product to show that it gives it a slight change in tone. Gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Yujeee

customer_reviews.title: Must have for leather protection
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I applied it to my new leather messenger bag and it softened up the leather, allowed the leather to move/bend easier, and gave it a deep rich appearance (darkened it as well a bit). I like the natural beeswax element which melts to a liquid when your fingers warm it up allowing you to massage the product into the leather. Product goes on “clean” without it being overly greasy but still seems to be a good protectant. I would buy again with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great treatment to my boots. Wanted something for a new pair of leather hunting boots I purchased and this was recommended on a card placed in the actual box. I read some reviews and very pleased with the product and end result. It does go on fairly easily by hand and gave each boot two coats just to make sure I got it. It will darken the leather but that wasn't a big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Waxy coating that protects effectively
customer_reviews.text: Quality ingredients, and mostly natural (beeswax, tree resins, natural oils). Provides a thick, waxy coating to protect your leather goods from water and grime. My only complaint is that where I live (Canada), it's pretty cold so the wax doesn't really liquefy and absorb into the leather. Some people suggested running it under a hair dryer to help melt the wax but I didn't find that made much difference. It also darkens your leather significantly, and any creases in the leather will expose the lighter colour underneath giving it a weird cracked look, though it doesn't affect the effectiveness of this product. Still giving it 5 stars because it does what it says and it's made of good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Alex LeDudeman

customer_reviews.title: Tough. Tough. Tough.
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow is this stuff tough. I used this on all my leather boots and shoes (and even some of my friends' boots and shoes) and it really holds up. Where I give it the most abuse is on my hunting boots. After the last waterproofer I used failed in a rain storm, I switched to this, and my feet have been dry ever since, regardless of whether I'm walking through marshy ground or in a constant rain. I haven't submerged my boots to test it, but I think that'd be about what it would take to get this stuff to fail.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Brand new boots!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! Where has this been my entire life?! My boyfriend bought me these boots years ago and I stopped wearing it because of how scratched up and ugly it looked. One day, I decided to wear it again but still hate how it looks and then I found this! It looks amazing and brand new! I just couldn’t believe my eyes. I used nitrile hospital gloves because I’m weird like that. Haha. I have long nails so I didn’t want it to get underneath it but it works amazing! No need for a rag!
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Professional hiker here
customer_reviews.text: I hike for a living. Off trail in rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest (wildlife biologist). My boots are of paramount importance, and this is what I've used for over a dozen years. I am also an equestrian, and my leather paddock boots take quite the beating, a lot of wet/dry with bathing horses or walking through damp pasture grass. Obenauf's keeps the leather from drying out and protects the leather from water. A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Rex

customer_reviews.title: Good waterpoofing, Not for cleaning, restoration
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that this product seems to be a Vaseline type base. Probably works well for waterproofing boots, etc. It is really not great for cleaning, conditioning or restoring leather, and takes awhile to dry. Think about what you are going to use it for before buying. There are better products for cleaning and restoring leather on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Rager

customer_reviews.title: Used this on several leather jackets
customer_reviews.text: This product is a paste. I oiled the jackets first with a more liquid white mineral oil based product using a pad applicator first and then allowed the jackets to set overnight. The next day I used my hands and this paste product massaging it into the leathers, which absorbed it quite well. It turned out to be a nice process that established a superb coating on my jackets....all now ready for the fall and winter.
customer_reviews.author: WesZ

customer_reviews.title: Very thick. Might need a buffer.
customer_reviews.text: Very thick. Decided not to use on expensive leather sofa. Most likely would need an electric buffer to apply correctly. Ion instead used spray on BEE’S WAX, a wonderful furniture polish good for leather and even polishing mirrors! ( they should pay me! 😉)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brophy Wall

customer_reviews.title: It does everything it claims!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a pretty harsh environment as such I like to keep my boots protected. This stuff is a very dense Protestant, as such it does take a bit of time to apply. I found I needed to apply two coats to my boots because the leather was quite dry. After getting the leather treated this stuff is awesome, the nasty coolant from the machines I work on just beads up and rolls off, same with water. I got my boots covered with some really fine dust that I was able to just spray off. I would recommend this Protestant, it does everything it claims!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ray

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for a reason
customer_reviews.text: I abused a pair of Wolverine 1000 mile shoes. I had them for 2 years. Once in a while I washed them with saddle soap and applied Red Wing Creme for protection. Nothing that I applied worked well and actually probably damaged the leather. I applied 3 rounds of this- the shoes look great. Rich leather tone. Took the scuffs and gouges out. I decided to do all the shoes and belts that were leather. It’s also made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: The only leather conditioner I use
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Red Wing boots my whole life for work and this product easily extends the life of the boot. Since using this product, the cracks that can occur in leather (from the leather getting too dry) have never came back. The waterproofing is a huge plus as well. The only time my boots become non water proof is when the stitching failed (not due to this product). I cannot recommend this product enough. I've used mink oil in the past and I can say with certainty, this one is better.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Leather Protected
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of leather boots so this proves to be an invaluable product. I usually apply this by hand and rub it in as the warmth from your hand makes it softer to apply. I also tried this on an elephant leather belt that I have and it works perfectly as well. There's also a pleasant honey-like scent so please don't be tempted to eat it. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Legendary D

customer_reviews.title: Six Stars, ****ing Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of THE BEST products I have ever ordered on amazon. Not only does it preserve, but it makes a great after-shine in my opinion, especially in the winter. I even use it just to quick re-shine boots that were sitting around, saves a ton of time, and you can just smear it all over your hands. Pollen does stick to it, so I'd go light if you are using it for dress during high pollen times. Does indeed seem all natural, Beeswax/Propolis. Furthermore, it smells wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Hopefully Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great for car leather that needs TLC.
customer_reviews.text: We have used multiple times here in the shop. Namely cars that come in that haven't been conditioned in Years. Will apply and allow to sit overnight...look for the areas that have dried...re-apply. Do this until sections no longer dry out over a night or two. Brings back the richness and suppleness that makes leather wonderful. Used a Plethora of other products..glad I finally found this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: jhodg5ck

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff but test your particular shoes for color-fastness first
customer_reviews.text: Goes on easily. I used nitrile gloves so it wouldn't soak into my hands, which didn't need waterproofing or softening anyway. Very nice scent - smells like honey. The smell is not noticeable unless you put the shoe up to your nose, though. I did have an issue with the black color coming off a pair of Vivobarefoot RA II shoes after using this. I do not know if the color would have rubbed off prior to using the Obenauf's, though. The shoes I put it on are black and the look and color was unchanged by it.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Person

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Recommended Product
customer_reviews.text: I Really enjoy using it, more than other Leather Preservatives i own. it is also performing well as solidifying nutrition for weakened or softened leather, good remedy for such leathers. needs to be applied generously and left to soak and unite with the leather to strengthen it. so far it works. also great as general purpose preservative. good texture and feeling and nice smell. will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Natural, Easy to Apply, Leather Protectant
customer_reviews.text: Product Experience/Outcome I used this on a pair of black Dr.Martens I bought. It made them appear darker which was fine by me. Works well enough that I don’t feel water inside the shoe when I’m walking in lots of rain or through occasional puddle jumps. That being said I haven’t tested what would happen if I stood in a deep enough puddle of water so I have no idea extent of waterproofing this salve provides in that regard. Product Characteristics It’s similar to grease that’s stable at room temp. It does melt at body temperature, though. Easy to apply (I used my hands). Natural product that doesn’t smell like chemicals. A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: tbrewer

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't be in the automotive section
customer_reviews.text: For boots, i can see that this stuff would work great. I searched leather conditioner's in the automotive section and this product came up. The ratings are great. I used it on my car's leather seats. It went on easily in the Florida heat but when it cooled down at night, the ventilation holes in my seat were filled with this wax as it congealed. I used a hair dryer to reheat and let it melt into the seat. My mistake
customer_reviews.author: Al in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Nice leather conditioner and restoring product.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is really great for leather conditioning. I previously used the Kiwi Mink Oil which works well but has silicone which sometimes turns white. The Obenauf's LP really penetrates into the leather and you can tell this will keep the leather moisturized for quite a while. The application is very easy and it seems to melt when rubbed and it has a spicy smell after application. Overall very good product. The price is a bit more than the other product but it seems it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Decimus Meridius

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pair with my Danner Super Rainforest boots. Seems to waterproof them ok, the only thing I wish they supplied was a foam applicator like what doc marten used to back in the day. They recommend using your hands and fingers to apply it, Then your body heat helps melt the product and work into the boots. I’ll update in a couple months after we get thru the real test of winter.
customer_reviews.author: KJD

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on several different items. I put it on goat skin boots, as well as cow hide boots and it worked perfectly. I wanted this product to darken my cow hid boots and it did exactly that. Additionally I bought a softball glove for my 10 year old daughter and I used it on the glove as well. The glove loosened up and has been great. Side note....the softball glove is white, I was nervous about applying it to a white glove, but I did it anyway and it didn't darken it all, in fact it stayed the same color.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for my Henschel Leather Hat!
customer_reviews.text: After recently purchasing a Henschel Walker leather hat right here on Amazon I reached out to a friend who makes leather products for advice on how to protect it. He highly recommended this product as the best for leather protection from the elements. It’s recommended that you use your bare hands to apply it as the heat from your skin helps melt it into the pores of the leather. It applies easily and you can add as many coats as you feel you may need. It will darken the leather to some degree so just be aware if that is an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Hinezy

customer_reviews.title: Its okay stuff
customer_reviews.text: Not sure where some of these reviewers purchase their honey, this product does not smell like any honey I've ever experienced. It does soften leather and brings a nice luster. It will darken the hide, I've had to apply a couple of quotes on leather duffel. It's ok, not the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Tamudawson

customer_reviews.title: Conditions leather and will seemingly last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: This container is huge and I don't know if I'll ever need to buy another. I use it on my Wolverine 1000 mile boots, and my Allen Edmonds cap toes every once in a while. It helps condition the leather from drying out and makes them more weather proof. It also helps soften the leather to ease break in. I don't really know what else to say. It does what it says it does, and goes on easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheeseburgersub

customer_reviews.title: Perforated leather beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I found out the hard way. Do not use on perforated leather seats. I applied this product to my front and back seats of the car and noticed all the pores had that gunk left inside. I had to clean my seats then vacuum up the residue. Some if it is still in there so I need to try again tomorrow. I guess I'll stick to leather wipes.
customer_reviews.author: MONAROD

customer_reviews.title: My old couches came instantly alive!! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product!! My 15-yr-old parched, Canadian reindeer leather couches had never been moisturized. I chose this product based on the great ratings and can only add my own fantastic experience to the reviews. My couches came to life instantly and they look gorgeous! Very easy application. One jar handled 2 couches. I’m absolutely thrilled! 😄
customer_reviews.author: Dana P.

customer_reviews.title: The Bee’s Knees
customer_reviews.text: Primo product. Brought my black boots back to full glory from an ashy state not having been conditioned before. First day out and about after treating them we got 6” snow and I was stomping along like a giddy little kid without the slightest worry that my feet wouldn’t stay dry. Brought an 8 year old belt back to life as well as treated my leather phone case that had started to darken on the edges from the natural oils from my hands from regular day to day use resulting in a nice dark brown that I was hoping for
customer_reviews.author: El Chupacabro

customer_reviews.title: Get this.  You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Softens leather, great smell, easy to apply. I applied the conditioner with a rag first. My second application I used my fingers to massage it into the leather with much better results. I would strongly encourage that method. I do not anticipate I will need to reorder this product anytime soon, but it is certainly on top of my list after ordering Huberd’s, Kiwi mink oil, and this. Obenauf’s is by far the best of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Klint

customer_reviews.title: This stuff would be great on belts
customer_reviews.text: This stuff would be great on belts, but not on work boots. I have red wing boots and do concrete in Alabama, I cleaned the boots very well then rubbed it all over the boots with my fingers like it says too do. Waited 5-6 hrs then reapplied to the boots the next day it looked like I didn't even put any on... by all means I am not Downing the product just saying it might not be the right stuff for heavy-duty leather
customer_reviews.author: Josh scritchfield

customer_reviews.title: Restores leather to look like new.
customer_reviews.text: This product works miracles. I had a leather portfolio for legal pads and a 1970s 5x7 leather notebook with an intricate cover. Both had been stored in a damp basement and were covered with mildew. I wiped the mildew off with a damp cloth then applied Obenauf's leather conditioner with my finger. I was astounded. Both look like they did when first purchased and have retained that appearance.
customer_reviews.author: susan carpenterTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: The best waterproofing I've found!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see by the boots pic. they turned out super supple (were hard and dried out), the oilskin hat is darker (and I'll admit greasy feeling, but this stuff was made for leather) and super water repellent. The duster looks like new, feels like new and works great. I know this is sold as only for leather, but I figured oilskin conditioner is a form of wax and oils, not much different, and with the anti-bacterial, chemical and salts protection it would keep my gear for years to come. For me it was worth a try and I am more than satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy B

customer_reviews.title: Great wax for leather mittens
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is very easy to use with just a rag or small sponge. it does take a couple days to dry/lighten up again after applying though so be aware of that before using it. I attached photos of treated vs non treated mitten, and then a picture of the mitten after about 4 days of drying. The wax darkens the leather quite a bit initially, but when it dries, it lightens back to almost the original color.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Makes Uggs and Clarks leather boots look old
customer_reviews.text: Used for my Clarks and Uggs black leather riding boots. On both boots it piles up in creases once you start wearing boots making boots looks old. Boots now look matte/grayish, with leather creases (from wear) white.
customer_reviews.author: Snegurochka

customer_reviews.title: bestreviews.com  Rates  OBENAUF’S Leather Preservative the best of the Best! They’re right.
customer_reviews.text: For honest reviews check out bestreviews.com I read their Leather care products reviews & glad I did. Their reviews lead me to order OBENAUF’S Heavy Duty leather preservative. Rating it best of best I ordered it from Amazon on bestreviews.com web page. Saving 6$ I bought the 8 OZ plastic jar from Amazon. I used it on shoes and a couch, impressed is an understatement. I’ll be using it on my car seats next.
customer_reviews.author: Mule

customer_reviews.title: Does what it say it does!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in conjunction with leather cleaners and others leather conditioning products. A little does the job of conditioning your item, too much may slightly darken the color of you item. I applied it after cleaning my lambskin handbags and regular leather handbags. I used my fingers to apply it (it's natural) then buffed after using a soft polishing/buffing clothes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: Greatr product and delivery was next day.
customer_reviews.text: What an great experience! I ordered this one day and it was delivered the next, amazing, just amazing. I could tell the minute I open the jar that this was a very good product. Went on easily and appeared to actually soak into the leather. The price was reasonable, the delivery was super fast and the product was/is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Combs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product- the best available.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. It does take some effort to apply correctly - heat up your leather item with a hair dryer, apply liberally- but the results are fantastic. It perfectly protects my boots from the elements, while keep the leather supple and in great condition. The stuff smells great and is non staining, no greasy residue either. I used these on some incredibly beatup boots that I may have thrown away and Obenaufs was restorative and gave second life to them. I highly recommend this product- if you have some nice leather winter boots, or desert boots, or belts, whatever. The stuff is an essential part of preserving and caring for your leather goods.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Obenauf’s is a terrific product
customer_reviews.text: Obenauf’s is a terrific product. It’s creamy product that softens in you fingers for easier application to your leather. And because it is nontoxic and natural, it isn’t harmful to handle directly. It has a wonderful smell of honey from the honeycomb bees wax and seals your leather. Be sure to test it on an inconspicuous area as it may turn your leather slightly darker.
customer_reviews.author: Jon I.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on my fire boots for years and it works great at keeping the leather supple while protecting it from water. I usually use this twice a year on my boots, once in spring and again in late autumn to protect against water, then I touch up as needed with the oil version. It's too bad they don't sell the gallon quantity on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tsubaki

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this boot grease for years on my Whites work boots. It keeps the leather supple and protected from grease , Hydraulic oil and all the other hazards that that you run across working on heavy equipment. It is all I use on my work boots and I also use it on my dress boots let it soak in and polish them later. If you want to keep your leather in good condition then use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Brock

customer_reviews.title: Great product which will darken your leather
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I used it on my recently saddle soaped boots (4 or 5 pairs) and loved the way that they turned out. It will darken your leather, but the protection is a fantastic trade-off. I applied it with my fingers, and it has the consistency of almost candle wax. Your body heat actually activates it and makes it spreadable. It instantly heals the scratches on your leather, and looks greasy/oily at first when applied. Once it soaks in, it has a duller, matte appearance, which can be buffed into more of a shine. It's a great way to protect the investment you've made in your footwear.
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: The best! Especially if you go to Burning Man.
customer_reviews.text: I was a wildland firefighter over ten years ago and still have my boots thanks partially to this boot grease. It has kept the leather supple, even when stored for a long amount of time. This is perfect for anyone going to Bruning Man. The alkaline dust there is very similar to ash and this product is made specifically to deal with that alkalinity. I expect to get another ten years put of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff. Don't really use any thing else for work, hunting, or hiking boots. Turned an $8 pair of red wings thrift find into a restored great looking boot. Will definitely darken light and tan leather but the color lightens up after fully absorbed. Also keep a small altoid tin for waxing my mustache.
customer_reviews.author: alk

customer_reviews.title: My preferred choice for boots
customer_reviews.text: I've kept a nice pair of leather boots going for 6 years and counting with this stuff. I just did a new pair of boots as well and that prompted me to write this review. I have this and Huberd's shoe grease and honestly prefer the Obenauf's. It feels more waxy and balmy feeling compared to Huberd's which feels more oily to me. Leather loves Obenauf's. These new boots soaked it right in and after a couple days are good to go. Waterproofing is excellent and with one or two applications per season it keeps the leather conditioned and looking great as it wears and breaks in. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Baumer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, really works well on leather boots
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time in harsh conditions, snow, mud, water on my once waterproof but aging boots. It works well and really seems good for the leather. It does have a little bit of a smell although it's good and smells a bit like beeswax so not sure if that's bad to use on hunting boots. Have used on my other shoes/boots for my family for preserving longevity
customer_reviews.author: cavaliersam

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. It really softens the leather. There is not much in the way of shine if that is your preference. It gives good waterproofing. I have used it on a few leather briefcases, camera bags, camera straps and several pairs of shoes. it will darken the leather. Test on a spot first. Wonderful smell, and your hands feel great when you are done too. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A Sousa

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have a beautiful handmade leather purse... and life can be rough on a bag you carry everyday, everywhere. The first picture shows how worn the front flap had become on the left side, and then with one fresh layer of Obenauf's on the right. The second picture is after it had dried and I buffed it with a soft cloth. I'll add to this review once it's been rained on! ha
customer_reviews.author: Ma

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product
customer_reviews.text: Everything everything I own made of leather has now been treated with Obenauf's. I have had consistently good results on a range of items from a pair of 1980's work boots to Italian leather chairs, . It works particularly well on Aniline dyed leather. I have not had any problems with it gooping up on seams or wingtip boots like some have reported. It does dry to a matt finish which I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Perez

customer_reviews.title: REEKS of cinnamon!
customer_reviews.text: No where in the description of the product do they tell you that the product smells very strongly of cinnamon. As i would have been using this on my duty gear, the last thing I need is to be broadcasting my presence with a strong smell of cinnamon. It is useless for me. I gave the jar of it to a friend to use on her saddles .
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McClung

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff, or, "I put that s*** on everything"
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Smells good, protects, looks nice. I really like it. I put it on everything leather, from shoes and boots, knife handles, dog collars, etc. I've even used it on wood. Word of warning: it can darken lighter brown leather quite a bit, so test it in an inconspicuous spot first and make sure you like the way it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stuff
customer_reviews.text: Powerful stuff that completely changed my boots! It bright the color profile down from a bright yellow to a deep amber red, but more over, they now looks, feel so supple & waterproofed even deeper! Will be using this every six to eight weeks from now to keep my work boots as strong for as long as they can!
customer_reviews.author: Albert Lamm

customer_reviews.title: A little definitely goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: I ran out of the mink oil I was using. Working in the gasfields if NEPA I am always in water, mud, etc so they take a lot of abuse. I decided to give Obenaufs a shot and I'M pretty happy with the look, feel, and ease of use. I bought the 8 oz tub and this will last a while so it's worth the extra money. I'm looking forward to seeing how it fairs since we are in the middle wet winter. I'm going to put a couple coats on and let it bake in my boot dryer for now.
customer_reviews.author: Big Kyle 570

customer_reviews.title: Has an odd smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to refresh my leather wallet. It has an unappealing smell (don't expect a beeswax smell). It was real oily when applied, and didn't run in super great. I think this may be better suited for very large leather items. I wouldn't purchase again, it was like rubbing coconut oil into my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: First preservative used, totally happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This is the first leather preservative/conditioner I’ve used, but I found it really easy to apply and excellent for weather and waterproofing. It can definitely change the color of the item (as in the boots shown), so it’s best to do a small testing area before you do the entire application. If you’re looking to completely weatherproof your boots, I would recommend at least two applications to begin with. A useful test is to spritz some water onto the boots and see if it beads up; if not, do another application.
customer_reviews.author: Collin N

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for over 20 years. It is still the best thing out there! I have tried other products in between or when Obenauf's was hard to find, but the results are never as good. I'm an industrial mechanic, hunter, hiker, and sometimes farmer and Obenauf's is my go-to choice for every occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!  My old boots are wearable again.
customer_reviews.text: Wow happy i listened to the good reviews. These redwing boots are old as you can tell but i love them. The leather got dried out to the point where they were hurting my feet. I dont know whats in this obenauf's but it made them soft and supple again. It didnt take much to do it either.
customer_reviews.author: dennd6

customer_reviews.title: Protects and conditions leather.
customer_reviews.text: Protects and conditions leather without changing the color too much. it changes the color about the same amount as apple leather products and puts a nice sheen. I use it for boots, bags, and leather jackets but I don’t use it for delicate leathers that need to breath like vecheta.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo M

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a patient man
customer_reviews.text: This stuff takes some time to apply, but one tub will last a really really long time. I think it's the best product of you so far. But you will have to take it slow. Side note it also works great on wood, if you put it on scratched wood the scratch will blend in with the polyurethane.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars all the way!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews for products, but I’m astonished by how easy this product was to use and what a difference it made to my boots. I wish so badly I had taken before shots of my sad boots because now they look amazing. I don’t mind using my hands for application, but that may be the only downside someone might find in this product. 5 stars all the way! This stuff just saved me hundreds on a cobbler! 🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼🙌🏼
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for leather upholstery.
customer_reviews.text: I used this leather treatment for the arms of my desk chair, which were showing signs of drying out and cracking. After a couple applications, and letting the preservative sit overnight, the leather greatly improved. My only regret is that I didn't buy this sooner. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mccandless

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used for boots and bags
customer_reviews.text: I use this to protect and condition the leather boots I use when driving a tow truck in bad weather, including rain, sleet, snow and road salt. Goes on easy. Two coats recommended. I apply several times a year as routine maintenance. Highly recommended by loggers and smoke jumpers. Very happy with it. Will use on all my leather, including motorcycle bags.
customer_reviews.author: James Krah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent leather care products, made in the USA...
customer_reviews.text: Our family wears nothing but leather boots and shoes. We've used tons of different leather care products, some are good and some are bad, but Obenauf's products are by far the best we've found. Taking the tame to take care of the leather makes it last SO much longer! We're hard on our shoes, so we normally use Obenauf's Heavy Duty LP twice a year, and we also us the Obenauf's Leather Oil every couple of months in between. Both products are fabulous and they are made in the USA too!
customer_reviews.author: mrsbrewguymike

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile, great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everything from waterproofing my boots to conditioning our leather Chesterfield sofas. Last year I had put this on my boots. It kept my feet warm and dry through a day long deluge. I mean we were walking around in the driving rain for 6 hours. This stuff is unequaled.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply.
customer_reviews.text: Used my hands to rub into boots. Like the leather was thirsty! Nice afterwards. Worth price and effort. Was told this is the best stuff for that kind of thing. Tried it on my watch band next. Nice and supple it has become. My leather organizer is rejuvenated. I'm now looking for things to moisturize!
customer_reviews.author: Jill A

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product after it was recommended to me by a friend and it has worked out wonderfully. I put my boots through a lot in the winter months but you wouldn't be able to tell thanks to this product. It is easy to use and goes will save you money on boots in the long run. Just apply with a rag and wipe off the excess, it's as simple as that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for preserving leather
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality of this product. It was recommended to me by my boyfriend who has used it for years and I can see why! It’s fantastic. My only negative is that it made my tan leather boots a darker brown than I would prefer. That being said, i’d rather them be a couple shades darker than to be cracked, scuffed, and ruined. Just something to note: this will make the leather a few shades darker.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Harris

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works and works very well.  Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I was using another brand that’s almost the same. This brand has a few better properties and it keeps working itself into the leather as you wear your boots I’ve noticed I have not had to reapply and it’s been 3 month the other brands I was reapplying every month.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J Sidwell

customer_reviews.title: Obenauf's is fantastic. I bought this as an organic
customer_reviews.text: As many reviewers will tell you, Obenauf's is fantastic. I bought this as an organic, natural way to preserve the leather headband and ear cups of my Sennheiser Momentum over-ear headphones. The preservative is very easy to apply, with just the heat of your fingertip enough to liquify it, and once it sees the leather, it seeps right in. If what you're applying it to will touch your skin (like headphone ear cups), I recommend letting it sit for 1-2 days, as it gives the leather a stickiness - obviously from the tree sap in the preservative. A little bit of Obenauf's goes a LONG way, and this little 4oz vial is going to last me a number of years.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, does exactly what it claims
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled upon this product via YouTube & let me tell you...it works great! Wore it during rainy weather & it’s definitely H2O proof. But be advised, it will alter the color of your leather shoes. I actually prefer the altered color of my boots (chippewa) now.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie K

customer_reviews.title: Best boot conditioner I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: Used this on some new boots and it does exactly what it is supposed to. I work in the asphalt industry and this made cleaning my boots off easier than other boot conditioners as well as keeping the leather in good shape. Never had an issue with water getting through or cracking.
customer_reviews.author: bigsickjoke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product that revitalized two pair of worn out old boots. I even tried it on an old dried out leather belt and it worked great! A very light application on dress shoes and it fixed some light scuffs. Do note that it will make older dried out leather look darker, as you would expect more of a wet leather look. I coated a newer pair and a brand new pair of boots and can’t say anything negative.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Makes the skin smooth, dark, and soft; two fingers is all you need; the stickyicky goes away
customer_reviews.text: Look at the pictures! As numerous others stated, it goes on easily with just your fingers, leaves a slightly sticky residue that becomes less sticky over time, darkens the leather as it’s absorbed but will lighten over time. It’s pricey but seems to work well. It doesn’t make my home smell like turpentine or petroleum.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Its not 4 ounces its more like 3.
customer_reviews.text: Its not 4 ounces its more like 3. I received the product in a contaner marked 4 ounces (stamped into the contaner by the contaner manufacturer) however it was only filled up part way about two inches from the top. 3/4 full at the most. For that price you should get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Robzilla

customer_reviews.title: The best for leather!
customer_reviews.text: The firefighters use it. Youre silly if you don't! I live in Minnesota where we get all the weather - this is amazing for hiking shoes, casual shoes, winter boots. Any leather shoe you have. (I've even treated a couple pairs of my leather heels.) With this protectant on my Miendl hiking boots, I crossed a creek in Yosemite on a backpacking trip and I watched the water just bead up and fall off my boot. It was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

product_meta.title: Obenauf’s Heavy Duty LP Leather Conditioner Natural Oil Beeswax Formula (4oz)
feature_bullets: Repels chemicals, manure acid, salt, concrete

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,248 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
